text: Learning new programming language, useful projects?
So I have to learn python for an upcoming project at work.
I know plenty of languages so I'm not too worried, but the project hasn't started yet so I can't learn python as I work on the project.
Instead of just going through tutorials and programming random trivial stuff, is there someplace that maybe have open (but simple) problems to solve?
I'd go through projecteuler problems, but solving problems for the sake of solving them seems like a waste of time if someone can get some use out of my learning.
Maybe a central place for open source projects that need small pieces of code written?
